lead_paragraph: The execution of Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, an outspoken campaigner for Shiite rights, is likely to exacerbate sectarian tensions across the Middle East.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.

headline.print_headline: Saudi Execution of Shiite Cleric Draws Outrage
headline.main: Iranian Protesters Ransack Saudi Embassy After Execution of Shiite Cleric

snippet: The execution of Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, an outspoken campaigner for Shiite rights, is likely to exacerbate sectarian tensions across the Middle East.
abstract: Saudi Arabia executes Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, outspoken critic of Sunni-dominated nation's treatment of Shiites, drawing regional condemnation and sending Iranian protesters to ransack Saudi Embassy in Tehran; Nimr is executed on terrorism charges along with 47 other prisoners, move seen as warning to domestic dissidents; many fear execution will exacerbate sectarian tensions across Middle East and further embolden Islamic State.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
